Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Adjuvant Statin Therapy in Oesophageal Adenocarcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: multicentre, double-blind, parallel-group, randomised, placebo-controlled feasibility trial

Participants.evidence: adults with OAC (including Siewert I–II lesions) post-oesophagectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomised (1:1) to simvastatin 40 mg or placebo

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the feasibility of a phase III RCT of adjuvant statin therapy in operable OAC.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was drug absorption, measured by LDL cholesterol levels at 3 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: centrally randomised (1:1) to simvastatin 40 mg or placebo using block randomisation, stratified by centre.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included participants, clinicians, and investigators.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 120 patients assessed, 32 (26.7%) were randomised, 16 per group. Recruitment occurred from October 2014 to July 2016.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 32 (26.7%) were randomised, 16 per group. Seven withdrew.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Simvastatin reduced LDL cholesterol by 3 months (adjusted mean difference −0.83 mmol/l, 95% CI −1.4 to −0.22; p = 0.009).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups, with no significant differences in frequency or severity.
